IssueType.Description: The shape of the result set produced by a SELECT * statement will change if the underlying table or view structure changes.
A column without an index that is used as an IN predicate test expression might degrade performance.
Avoid using patterns that start with "%" in LIKE predicates
A column in an expression to be compared in a predicate might cause a table scan and degrade performance.
Nullable columns can cause final results to be evaluated as NULL for the predicate.
Potential misuse of system function @@IDENTITY.
Avoid {0} of only {1}.
Old-style JOIN syntax is used.
Object name({0}) contains special characters.
{0}({1}) is used as a type name.
Output parameter ({0}) is not populated in all code paths.
Data types of {0}({1}) and {2}({3}) are incompatible.
Deterministic function call ({0}) might cause an unnecessary table scan.
Stored procedure({0}) includes sp_ prefix in its name.
Avoid cross server joins
Best practice is to use two part naming
Dirty Reads cause consistency errors
Dont Override the optimizer
Avoid use of 'Select *'
Avoid Explicit Conversion of Columnar data
Avoid use of ordinal positions in ORDER BY Clauses
Dont Change DateFormat
Dont Change DateFirst
ReadUnCommitted: Dirty reads can cause consistency errors
Single character aliases are poor practice
Missing Column specifications on insert
CONCAT_NULL_YIELDS_NULL should be on
ANSI_NULLS should be On
ANSI_PADDING should be On
ANSI_WARNINGS should be On
ARITHABORT should be On
NUMERIC_ROUNDABORT should be Off
QUOTED_IDENTIFIER should be ON
FORCEPLAN should be OFF
Use 2 part naming in EXECUTE statements
Identity value should be agnostic
Avoid single line comments
Use two part naming
RANGE windows are much slower then ROWS (Explicit use)
RANGE windows are much slower then ROWS (Implicit use)
Create table statements should specify schema
Ordering in a view does not guarantee result set ordering
Cursors default to writable. Specify FAST_FORWARD
Include SET NOCOUNT ON inside stored procedures
EXISTS/NOT EXISTS can be more performant than COUNT(*)
Ordering in a derived table does not guarantee result set ordering
Single character variable names are poor practice
Expression used with TOP should be wrapped in parenthises
TOP(100) percent is ignored by the optimizer
Foreign Key Constraints should be named
Check Constraints should be named
Primary Key Constraints on temporary tables should not be named
Default Constraints on temporary tables should not be named
Foreign Key Constraints on temporary tables should not be named
Check Constraints on temporary tables should not be named
Use of SET ROWCOUNT is deprecated : use TOP
Potential SQL Injection Issue
Dont override the optimizer ( FORCESCAN )
Dont override the optimizer ( Index Hint)
"= Null" Comparison
Use of deprecated data type
Table does not have a natural key.
Table does not have a primary key.
Primary Keys should avoid using GUIDS or wide VARCHAR columns.
Columns on both sides of a foreign key should be indexed.
Avoid the (n)char column type except for short static length data.
Avoid using SELECT *.
Wrap multiple action statements within a transaction.
Start identity column used in a primary key with a seed of 1000 or higher.
Equality and inequality comparisons involving a NULL constant found. Use IS NULL or IS NOT NULL.
Variable declared but never referenced or assigned.
Wrap multiple action statements within a try catch.
TOP clause used in a query without an ORDER BY clause.
Always use a column list in INSERT statements.
Input parameter never used. Consider removing the parameter or using it.
DELETE statement without row limiting conditions.
UPDATE statement without row limiting conditions.
Avoid joining tables with views.
The query has issues with the join clause. It is either missing a backing foreign key or the join is missing one or more columns.
Consider using EXISTS instead of IN when used with a subquery.
Avoid EXEC and EXECUTE with string literals. Use parameterized sp_executesql instead.
Avoid using column numbers in ORDER BY clause.
Do not use these data types (VARCHAR, NVARCHAR, CHAR, NCHAR) without specifying length.
Do not use DECIMAL or NUMERIC data types without specifying precision and scale.
Consider prefixing column names with table name or table alias.
Avoid using Hints to force a particular behavior.
Avoid using CHARINDEX function in WHERE clauses.
Try to avoid the OR operator in query where clauses if possible. (Sargable)
Avoid using cursors.
Do not use the NOLOCK clause.
Do not use WAITFOR DELAY/TIME statement in stored procedures, functions, and triggers.
Do not use SET ROWCOUNT to restrict the number of rows.
Consider aliasing all table sources in the query.
Use fully qualified object names in SELECT, UPDATE, DELETE, MERGE and EXECUTE statements. [schema].[name].
Avoid use of the SELECT INTO syntax.
The arguments of the function '{0}' are not of the same datatype.
The RAISERROR statement with severity above 18 requires the WITH LOG clause.
Excessive number of indexes on table found on table.
Do not use the real or float data types for parameters or columns as they are approximate value data types.
Avoid using columns that match other columns by name, but are different in type or size.
The comparison expression always evaluates to TRUE or FALSE.
Don't use deprecated TEXT, NTEXT and IMAGE data types.
Index has exact duplicate or borderline overlapping index.
Object has different collation than the rest of the database. Try to avoid using a different collation unless by design.
The object was created with invalid options.
Use OUTPUT or SCOPE_IDENTITY() instead of @@IDENTITY.
Do not mix DML with DDL statements. Group DDL statements at the beginning of procedures followed by DML statements.
Always use parameter names when calling stored procedures.
The procedure grants itself permissions. Possible missing GO command.
The database is configured with invalid options.
Create SQL Server temporary tables with the correct collation or use database default as the tempdb having a different collation than the database can cause issues and or data instability.
Do not use IF statements containing queries in stored procedures.
Cache multiple calls to GETDATE or SYSDATETIME into a variable.
Avoid 'NOT FOR REPLICATION' unless this is the desired behavior and replication is in use.
Use BEGIN and END symbols inside conditional statements.
Use capitalized keywords for enhanced readability.
Query statements should finish with a semicolon - ';'.
Avoid 'fn_' prefix when naming functions.
Avoid 'sp_' prefix when naming stored procedures.
Two part naming on objects is required.
General naming rules.
Views should not use other views as a data source.
Try to avoid using patterns that start with '%' when using the LIKE keyword if possible. (Sargable)
Avoid using DISTINCT keyword inside of aggregate functions.
Avoid returning results in triggers.
SET NOCOUNT ON is recommended to be enabled in stored procedures and triggers.
Try to avoid using not equal operator (<>,!=) in the WHERE clause if possible. (Sargable)
Local cursor not closed.
Local cursor not explicitly deallocated.
Avoid wrapping columns within a function in the WHERE clause. (Sargable)
Avoid the use of user defined functions with UPDATE/INSERT/DELETE statements. (Halloween Protection)
Avoid using the NOT IN predicate in a WHERE clause. (Sargable)
Consider indexing the columns referenced by IN predicates in order to avoid table scans.
Consider replacing the OUTER JOIN with EXISTS.
Avoid the use of table variables in join clauses.
Avoid the use of calculations on columns in the where clause. (Sargable)
Data types on both sides of an equality check should be the same in the where clause. (Sargable)
Avoid updating columns that are part of the primary key. (Halloween Protection)
Query uses a high number of joins.
Table does not have a clustered index.
Avoid modification of parameters in a stored procedure prior to use in a select query.
Consider using RECOMPILE query hint instead of the WITH RECOMPILE option.
When checking for existence use EXISTS instead of COUNT
Avoid the use of correlated subqueries except for very small tables.

Issue.Message: The database is configured with these invalid options: ANSI_NULLS OFF, ANSI_PADDING OFF, ANSI_WARNINGS OFF, ARITHABORT OFF, CONCAT_NULL_YIELDS_NULL OFF, QUOTED_IDENTIFIER OFF. (https://github.com/ErikEJ/SqlServer.Rules/blob/master/docs/Design/SRD0061.md)
Table does not have a primary key. (https://github.com/ErikEJ/SqlServer.Rules/blob/master/docs/Design/SRD0002.md)
Table does not have a clustered index. (https://github.com/ErikEJ/SqlServer.Rules/blob/master/docs/Performance/SRP0020.md)
Don't use deprecated TEXT, NTEXT and IMAGE data types. (https://github.com/ErikEJ/SqlServer.Rules/blob/master/docs/Design/SRD0051.md)
Don't use deprecated TEXT, NTEXT and IMAGE data types. (https://github.com/ErikEJ/SqlServer.Rules/blob/master/docs/Design/SRD0051.md)
Table does not have a primary key. (https://github.com/ErikEJ/SqlServer.Rules/blob/master/docs/Design/SRD0002.md)
Table does not have a clustered index. (https://github.com/ErikEJ/SqlServer.Rules/blob/master/docs/Performance/SRP0020.md)
Columns on both sides of a foreign key should be indexed for performance reasons. (https://github.com/ErikEJ/SqlServer.Rules/blob/master/docs/Design/SRD0004.md)
